"SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE." The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002 extends block grants, federal guarantees, training, and technical assistance provisions from 1998 to 2007. It also amends the Indian Housing Loan Guarantee Fund. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1992 is amended to specify fiscal years 1997 through 2007 for certain provisions. SEC. 3 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 defines 'housing related community development' as tribally-owned facilities or infrastructure that aid in the construction of reservation housing. It excludes activities under the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act. SEC. 4 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 amends Section 101(h) by adding "and Planning" to the heading and including provisions for comprehensive housing and community development planning activities. SEC. 5 amends Section 104 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 regarding program income and labor standards. It specifies the utilization of income for housing-related activities and the expenditure of retained program income. SEC. 7 amends Section 601 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 to include housing related community development activities. SEC. 8 adds a community development demonstration project to Section 202 of the Act. The Secretary shall conduct a study on the feasibility of establishing a demonstration project for Indian tribes to use funds for community development projects. The study must be submitted to Congress within 1 year of the Act's enactment. The Secretary will conduct a study on the feasibility of a demonstration project allowing Indian tribes to receive assistance for Federal housing and related activities with increased tribal authority. The study must be submitted to Congress within 1 year of the Act's enactment. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will conduct a study on black mold infestation in Native American housing within 180 days of the Act's enactment. A report with recommendations to address the infestation will be submitted to Congress.
